page.title: 02CLITHEROE CASTLE
page.content: Clitheroe Castle stands on a limestone hill overlooking the town. It was built shortly after the Norman Conquest by the De Lacy family. As well as the castle walls there was a keep, a main hall, kitchens and stables. There was also a church for use by foresters and peasants. Today only the keep remains, and that has seen better days. Originally the keep was divided into three stories. The first floor was for storing food and the only exit was a trap door leading to the floor above. The second floor was the main living quarters, hall and kitchens. On the third floor were the sleeping quarters. The keep could well be one of the oldest stone built structures in Lancashire, it will shortly be celebrating its 800th birthday.
